options.content:
## ðŸ“Š Infrastructure Metrics Guide

### **Memory Types (go_memory_usage_bytes)**
â€¢ **`heap`** - Active memory used by your application objects (structs, slices, maps)
â€¢ **`stack`** - Memory used by goroutine stacks (function calls, local variables)  
â€¢ **`sys`** - **Total OS memory reserved** by Go runtime (heap + stack + runtime overhead + pre-allocated pools)
  - This is what Docker sees and what counts against container limits
  - Usually larger than heap+stack due to Go's memory pre-allocation strategy

### **CPU Metrics**
â€¢ **CPU Usage %** - Estimated load based on goroutines per CPU core (higher = more concurrent work)
â€¢ **GC CPU %** - Percentage of CPU time spent in garbage collection
â€¢ **Goroutines per CPU** - How well work is distributed across available cores

### **CPU Throttling & Pressure**
â€¢ **CPU Throttling** occurs when your container/process is limited by:
  - Container CPU limits (Docker/Kubernetes)
  - System resource contention
  - Too many goroutines competing for CPU cores
â€¢ **Potential Throttling** = 1 when goroutines > 10x CPU cores (high scheduling pressure)
â€¢ **Goroutine Pressure** = Ratio of goroutines to CPU cores (ideal: close to core count)
â€¢ **GC Pressure** = High GC CPU usage indicating memory pressure affecting performance

### **CPU Core Metrics**
â€¢ **Available Cores** - Physical CPU cores detected by the system
â€¢ **Max Procs (GOMAXPROCS)** - CPU cores Go runtime can actually use (may be limited)
â€¢ **Parallel Efficiency** - How many goroutines per available core (ideal: close to max procs)
â€¢ **Core Pressure** - Scheduling contention indicator (Low/Medium/High)
